body_html: I think this should be protected by the way the hash is designed. It is merely adding 3 to the device index, which is upper bounded by the limit of int32_t. I don't think there can be a situation where the hash could overflow, but I could add it, if you deem it necessary.
body_text: I think this should be protected by the way the hash is designed. It is merely adding 3 to the device index, which is upper bounded by the limit of int32_t. I don't think there can be a situation where the hash could overflow, but I could add it, if you deem it necessary.
body: I think this should be protected by the way the hash is designed. It is merely adding 3 to the device index, which is upper bounded by the limit of `int32_t`. I don't think there can be a situation where the hash could overflow, but I could add it, if you deem it necessary.
